Nashville — Shownotes S01E08

By Test Author

Mailed on December 11, 2012


Dear

Dear ,

Dear Cast and Crew of Nashville, S1E08 – “Where Hew Leads Me”

Episode synopsis:
Rayna examines her priorities after listening to Teddy explain his situation with Peggy. Elsewhere, Juliette enjoys the bond she’s forming with Sean’s family; Gunnar makes a confession to Scarlett; and Avery and Deacon get terrific career opportunities.

Original air date:
December 5, 2012

Shownotes:

  • So much for the afterglow of Rayna and Juliette’s duet, eh Teddy?
  • Tell the props master that instead of programming “Mom’s Rehab” in Juliette’s phone, “Make Annoyed Face and Hang Up” would be perfectly clear.
  • What I would give to see Juliette actually chew out NFL Guy’s parents for raising a boy who won’t bone her without a ring.
  • Who did the location manager wrangle up to let you shoot around that acoustic guitar-shaped pool? My money is on Toby Keith.
  • That band just played the sober card (or chip) to rope in Deacon (or Chip)!
  • Hold on to that coffee filter Scarlett just got a phone number on. I have a feeling it will be worth a lot of drama soon.
  • Avery’s rock star cred is apparently being suspended from catholic school for playing Black Sabbath. Someone’s Paranoid about looking cool.
  • Coleman, showing Rayna some very lame scandal pictures: “If that’s not an affair, what it is?” Gee I don’t know, a hug?
  • White choirs just don’t pack a punch, do they?
  • Excessive smiles, church performances – the lengths Juliette will go to just to get laid.
  • Apparently strumming the banjo on a porch can be sexy. Who knew! Thank you, Scarlett.
  • Gunner lands the kiss! But of course, being straight-forward always misfires in a soap opera. Even a good one like this.
  • Those huge pictures of Rayna’s daughters in her room just reminded me that they’ve been strangely absent for many episodes. I want an encore of their performance!
  • I guess I would hold a grudge too if I had to eat dry pancake mix as a kid and had my first kiss from one of my mom’s boyfriends. Maybe even more pissed than Juliette (if that’s possible).
  • Glad to see the hair department got the note that Rayna needs to look more uptight with all those ponytails she’s getting this episode.
  • Look at all those candles Juliette put out hoping her man would put out!  What? Don’t tell me she’s going to… dear God. The lady proposal. Juliette may officially only wear pants from now on.

Closing comments: Lots of songs early kept the energy alive throughout this episode. Teddy might have been better off actually having an affair after Rayna’s reaction to his (temporary?) embezzlement, but hopefully the attempted suicide by Peggy is as far as they take this scandal. Also, I refuse to refer to Juliette’s potential fiancée as anything other than “NFL guy” because there’s no way he’ll last on this show…

Signed,

Christopher Redmond
